article.title: Do galaxies that leak ionizing photons have extreme outflows?

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 illustrate about the relationship between the LyC leaker sample and the control sample?
choices: LyC leakers have similar SFRs and metallicities to the control sample at a given stellar mass.
LyC leakers tend to have higher SFRs and lower metallicities than the control sample at a given stellar mass.
LyC leakers exhibit a wider range of stellar masses than the control sample.
LyC leakers follow a significantly different mass-metallicity relation than the control sample.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information is primarily conveyed by the Cosmic Origins Spectrograph ultraviolet spectra shown in Figure 2?
choices: The overall morphology of the LyC leaker galaxies.
The presence and properties of interstellar absorption lines in the leaker galaxies.
The distribution of dark matter within the leaker galaxies.
The redshift of the leaker galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main takeaway from the comparison of Si II and Si III absorption profiles in Figure 3?
choices: The LyC leakers have stronger and broader Si II and Si III absorption profiles compared to the control sample galaxy (NGC 6090).
The LyC leakers have weaker and narrower Si II and Si III absorption profiles compared to the control sample galaxy (NGC 6090).
The Si II and Si III absorption profiles show no significant differences between the LyC leakers and the control sample galaxy.
The Si II and Si III absorption profiles indicate that the outflowing gas in LyC leakers is primarily concentrated at systemic velocities within the galaxy.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Formula (5) describe about the relationship between HI column density (N<sub>HI</sub>) and the radial density profile (α)?
choices: As α approaches -1, N<sub>HI</sub> becomes increasingly sensitive to the initial density and radius of the outflow.
A density-conserving sphere (α = -2) results in the highest possible HI column density.
Large, negative values of α correspond to outflows where density is conserved and gas is not removed.
For α > -1, the HI column density is independent of the HI ionization fraction (X<sub>HI</sub>).
